ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Absolutely. For students without prior knowledge, it will be a difficult but enjoyable course, while for those more versed in philosophy, and course material appeared to be equally challenging, although obviously on another knowledge of inquiry.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: As it was my introductory course in philosophy, it helped me frame in my mind the nature and reason of philosophical discourse. Although the material covered, for the most part, authors that had written centuries ago, the course succeeded in framing such discourse within a contemporary context. Moreover, the structure of the course was such that it was both light-hearted at times, but also demanded critical thinking.
